body.p: A Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician. Graduated from Miami University (Oxford, Ohio) in 1857 and from the Cincinnati Law School in 1858. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Mount Sterling, Kentucky. Married to Sophia Brainerd McKee. Father of Frank McKee, Samuel McKee, Eugenia McKee Nettelroth, and Brainerd McKee. Served in the Civil War as a captain in the Fourteenth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry from 1862 to 1864. A prisoner of war for 13 months at Libby Prison. Served the Ninth Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist member of the United States House of Representative from 1865 to 1867.
